i have 3layd monitor and power iso tooo but how to play your movie in 3d,

To play Blu-ray 3D on a PC you must have either NVidia 3D Vision kit or a 3D ready TV with an HDMI 1.4 cable (wont work with 1.3) and a Blu-ray 3D player such as PowerDVD v.1x.0. The latest the better.

This is what I have learned so far. If you learn more useful info, please share in this page.

For further info, dig in this site: http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/blu-ray-3d-3d-vision-3d-home-theater,2636-6.html

I saw this movie in the theater and it has to be one of the best 3D movies out there--visually stunning. I would have purchased this if it were available (other than on eBay where it costs a fortune), so I was glad to find it here. It took about 5 days to finish downloading it, but I am very glad that this is the uncompressed version. I used ImgBurn (freeware) with an LG WH12S39K Blu-Ray drive and a Titan double layer BD-R (about $5 per disc from Shop4Tech in a 10-pack on sale). It took a little under an hour to burn. My 3D TV has not arrived yet, so I haven't seen how it plays on a larger screen, but it plays just fine on the computer using PowerDVD Ultra Version 12 (albeit with red/blue glasses which is rather lame--at least it shows that the disc plays in 3D). Hope this was helpful to someone. Many thanks for the upload!
